text: @ops the switch from corporate Uber to corporate Lyft is much appreciated!!
Speaking of Lyft. I really enjoyed the "How I built this" with John Zimmer from Lyft <http://www.npr.org/podcasts/510313/how-i-built-this>

attachments.title: How I Built This
attachments.text: How I Built This is a podcast about innovators, entrepreneurs, and idealists, and the stories behind the movements they built. Each episode is a narrative journey marked by triumphs, failures, serendipity and insight — told by the founders of some of the world's best known companies and brands. If you've ever built something from nothing, something you really care about — or even just dream about it — check out How I Built This hosted by Guy Raz @guyraz. Follow the show @HowIBuiltThis.

text: I would expect the entirety of this segment to be "well I saw that Uber was really popular so I copied their model"
is there anything partiularly "innovative" about lyft?
Yeah. They were the first ones to do the normal car, normal driver thing. Uber X copied Lyft
ohhhhh, had no idea Lyft did that first, crazy
so Uber initially was only black cars?
Yep. Only limos and black cars. They actually tried to block Lyft until they realized they could be much more popular by just copying them
Which goes super in-depth on the whole story? TL'DR Lyft>Uber
wow, wonder how many people don't know that story, maybe I just wasn't paying enough attention when they got started up
Speaking of How I Built this, did you know that the owner of Atari created Chucky Cheese?
I did...but only bc I love that podcast too...
all the episodes are so good
Very last minute, we have a few extra tickets for this tonight if anybody is interested in checking it out: <https://impactflow.com/event/march-vr-meetup-with-keynote-from-paul-reynolds-1745>

attachments.title: March VR Meetup with Keynote from Paul Reynolds, Portland
attachments.text: The Portland VR Meetup presents the first of many events in 2017.On Monday March 13th, we are teaming up with New Relic FutureTalks PDX to bring a fun evening of food, drinks, and networking! In addition we will have two presentations from the local VR companies, a keynote from Paul Reynolds(formally of Magic Leap), and lots of VR demos to experience.Come out for an amazing night of community building, VR experiences, learning about the local scene. We will have multiple VR experiences to demo and a few door prizes!Presenters: Michael Balzer is an engineer, developer, designer and inventor of a number of technology products. He began in the 90’s with products like ‘Perfect Sound’, ‘Perfect Vision’, and ‘Chroma Key’ to more recent products like ‘4eyes’, ‘NEODiMOUNT’ iPhones cases & accessories, and ‘NEODiVR uPLAy’ - the first fully immersive VR viewer you can put in your shirt pocket. Balzer has also developed VR content with “Graveyard Politics” for Google Cardboard & Daydream, available in both Google Play and Apple’s iTune Store, as well as apps that allow you to walk around an operating room with the help of the Occipital Structure Sensor - the first fully mobile positional tracking system you can buy right now, and the only one available for iOS. Sven Mesecke The PDX Hub - "Blending the history and growth of Portland's creativity and technology talent into community success within Virtual and Mixed Realities" Sven is a Co-founder of WirelessVR chipmaker, Nitero, transplanted from Austin to Portland in 2015 to explore further opportunities in our unique ecosystem. He will discuss from a relatively recent outside perspective, why Portland's history and talent pool within the arts and creative spaces, when combined with the presence of solid technology giants, global brands and start-up spirit, provides an excellent platform for success throughout the community in the emerging Reality spaces. As well, he will address a common question heard upon arrival for incoming talent pursuing VR and AR growth - "Why Portland"? Keynote: Paul Reynolds moved to Portland in 2016 after a 3 year run at Magic Leap as Senior Director of developer tools and apps. He will be speaking about “Mixed Reality 101” and how VR/AR technologies are tapping into human perception in ways we have never seen before and what it could mean for our future. Sponsors: Big thanks to these companies below. They are all showing up to provide amazing demos for our community, while also helping ensure that we can continue providing these valuable events every month. Check out the amazing work these local companies are doing. - New Relic offers a performance management solution enabling developers to diagnose and fix application performance problems in real time. <https://newrelic.com/> - Formed in 2014 PANOGS is a Portland based full-service virtual reality (VR) agency specializing in creating immersive and gigapixel hyper-resolution experiences from some of the tallest structures and most inaccessible places on earth.PANOGS will be co-presenting their aerial 360 video reel on the HTC Vive with their Aerial Partner VR Drones. <http://www.panogs.com|www.panogs.com> - Founded in Portland Oregon, VR Drones has designed a patent pending technology for capturing fully stabilized, airborne, 360 degree video content using small unmanned aerial systems. <http://www.vrdronesllc.com|www.vrdronesllc.com> - Launched in Portland in 2017, Rebel Camp is a curator and creator of technologies for consumer and arcade products for the Realities Markets. Our goal is to bridge the massive gap between a single creative vision and the myriad of challenges in mass production and distribution that limit the sharing of that vision with the worldwide consumer and entertainment markets. <http://rebel.camp/> - Virtual Voyages is a Portland based company dedicated to bringing Virtual Reality to the masses. We provide VR parties and events for all sorts of occasions, offering options for VR enthusiasts and first time users. We bring our equipment into your space and help run the whole event! <http://www.virtual-voyages.com|www.virtual-voyages.com> Inquires: For sponsorship inquires, interest in speaking at future events, or other questions/comments, please contact <mailto:Joshua.Joshua@reflectivebrands.com|Joshua.Joshua@reflectivebrands.com>
attachments.fallback: ImpactFlow: March VR Meetup with Keynote from Paul Reynolds, Portland
